main_definition: Harder is an adjective or comparative form of the word 'hard' that signifies increased difficulty, strength, firmness, intensity or resistance.

meanings_and_examples.example: Learning a new language can be harder than learning to play an instrument.
Chopping wood with a heavier ax makes the job harder, but it also leads to cleaner cuts.
The workout became harder as I progressed through each set of exercises.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Of greater resistance, requiring more force to overcome
meanings_and_examples.example: It was harder to push the car uphill than on a flat surface due to increased gravity's influence.
After receiving bad news, dealing with the situation became much harder than expected.
